p: The genus Cinnamomum comprises over 250 species cultivated commercially in tropical and subtropical regions of China, India, South America, and Africa (Jayaprakasha & Rao, 2011; Wang, Wang, & Yang, 2009). It has been proved that the cinnamon has anti‚Äêinflammatory, antimicrobial, antioxidant, cardiovascular, and immunomodulatory effects according to in vitro and in vivo evidence (Gruenwald, Freder, & Armbruester, 2010). So, as spice and traditional herbal medicine, cinnamon has been used widely for thousands of years in many countries, especially in China.
